page.title: 19 A LOCAL SWIMMING CLUB
page.content: Tynemouth Amateur Swimming Club has 90 active members.They train 5 times a week for a total of 6 hours.An average 1 hour session consists of the following:200m warm up,12x1 length butterfly,8x100 freestyle,6x4x1 length individual medley.On Tuesday nights members train on the swim bench which is similar to weight training to build up stamina.Usually about once or twice a month there are galas.Galas are competitions against other clubs which can be held at National and Local level.An entry card is used to identify the swimmers race.Often you can be there from 9.00am till 9.00pm,medals are awarded to the winners.In the mornings training is for 60 mins and at night for 90 mins.Swimming keeps you fit,but if you want to be a top class swimmer you must be extremely dedicated
